dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 687 IH: Protect Interstate Commerce Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. King of Iowa (for himself, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Neugebauer, Mr. Peterson, Mr. Blum, Mr. Huelskamp, and Mr. Young of Iowa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To prevent States and local jurisdictions from interfering with the production and distribution of agricultural products in interstate or foreign commerce.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Interstate Commerce Act.

section.header: Prohibition against interference by State and local governments with production or manufacture of items in other States

subsection.text: Consistent with article I, section 8, clause 3 of the Constitution of the United States, the government of a State or locality therein shall not impose a standard or condition on the production or manufacture of any agricultural product sold or offered for sale in interstate commerce if—

paragraph.text: such production or manufacture occurs in another State; and
the standard or condition is in addition to the standards and conditions applicable to such production or manufacture pursuant to—

subparagraph.text: the laws of the State and locality in which such production or manufacture occurs.

subsection.text: In this section, the term agricultural product has the meaning given such term in section 207 of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1626).
